parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate or party.  It promotes the idea of informed voting in general terms.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its message is clearly intended for a wide audience, not a specific individual or small group.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is not to influence the vote for a particular candidate. Instead, it encourages voters to be informed and make their own choices. The post promotes books that can help with this process, not a specific candidate or party.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post could be considered a form of public service announcement or citizens' journalism, aiming to promote informed civic engagement. It does not advocate for or against any particular candidate or party.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express a personal opinion; rather, it promotes a general message of informed voting.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>495828770135590</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post by Cărțurești promotes informed voting through reading. It does not endorse any specific candidate or party, and its aim is to encourage civic engagement. The post's content focuses on the importance of informed decision-making during elections, providing a list of books that can help voters.  While the post is related to the electoral process, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It lacks direct reference to a candidate or party (a), its objective is not to directly influence the vote for a specific candidate (c), and it remains within the boundaries of providing information rather than exceeding the limits of journalistic information (d). The timing of the post, even if after the official campaign period, is not problematic given its non-partisan and informative nature.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Cărțurești</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
